fields.description: It would be really nice, if there was the option to change the logo/title of the Stash-instance, like in Jira and Confluence. This would be more consistent.
fields.summary: Customize Logo/Title like in Jira and Confluence

fields.description:
Stash fails to add branch permissions for users who have not yet been licensed to use the system.  Instead, it simply says that xxx is not a licensed user (see screen shot).

We have Stash set up to use LDAP, and many project leads will log in, create projects, and set permissions before their team members have been given permission to use Stash.  The team leads then have to wait for the users to log in before they can set branch permissions, which slows people down.  It makes sense for team leads to be able to add permissions for anyone in LDAP, even if they haven't logged into Stash yet.

Also, inconsistently, you *can* add a permission for an unlicensed user at the repository level and the project level.  It's just branch permissions that fail this way.
fields.summary: Can't add branch permission for unlicensed user

fields.description:
when a user doesn't have access to a project it's currently hard for them to figure out who to request access to.

It would be good to have a button "Request Access" that creates a ticket for the project admins to approve/reject.

This would apply to both projects and repositories.

Robbin
fields.summary: Ability to request access when denied

fields.description:
Currently when a pull request is created, the auto-complete user list for possible reviewers will list all users. Ideally only those would be listed here that have access to the specific project. 

Especially in enterprise environments  or when external people have access to a project, it is crucial to separate users, not even letting other users to know about another set of users.
fields.summary: List possible reviewers only if the user has access to the project

fields.description:
Affects 2.7.0+ and masks the real migration failure exception
{noformat}
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: can't parse argument number: 
	at java.text.MessageFormat.makeFormat(MessageFormat.java:1420) ~[na:1.7.0_07]
	at java.text.MessageFormat.applyPattern(MessageFormat.java:479) ~[na:1.7.0_07]
	at java.text.MessageFormat.<init>(MessageFormat.java:363) ~[na:1.7.0_07]
	at java.text.MessageFormat.format(MessageFormat.java:835) ~[na:1.7.0_07]
	at com.atlassian.stash.internal.i18n.PluginI18nService.getText(PluginI18nService.java:94) ~[stash-service-impl-2.8.2.jar:na]
	at com.atlassian.stash.internal.i18n.PluginI18nService.getText(PluginI18nService.java:85) ~[stash-service-impl-2.8.2.jar:na]
	at com.atlassian.stash.internal.i18n.PluginI18nService.getKeyedText(PluginI18nService.java:72) ~[stash-service-impl-2.8.2.jar:na]
	at com.atlassian.stash.internal.maintenance.restore.ActiveObjectsRestoreStep.run(ActiveObjectsRestoreStep.java:74) ~[stash-service-impl-2.8.2.jar:na]
{noformat}
fields.summary: DB Migration fails with NumberFormatException

fields.description: Our workflow is tied to the naming of branches in a repo. We would like to restrict which users can create a branch that matches a certain pattern. So only certain users would be allowed to create a 'release-*' branch.
fields.summary: Restrict branch creation based on pattern

fields.description: As a user I'd still be interested in having it available in the UI how many users I have on my user base although my license is Unlimited. This is currently not shown in the "Admin cog icon -> License" screen for Unlimited users.
fields.summary: Unlimited license does not show how many users

fields.description: When browsing file versions it would be nice to have "previous" and "next" buttons in addition to the History drop-down. This would be really handy for when you're trying to track down a particular change in a particular file, but you don't know which revision it's in.
fields.summary: Previous / Next File Revision

fields.description:
Currently if the user creates a PR with JIRA issue key in the title, it won't make the reference to JIRA, unlike the comments or the description, it will make the reference to JIRA, which gives the ability to open the JIRA issue from by clicking on the issue key.

A screenshot to clarify this:
 !jira_key_pr.png!
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to have JIRA issue reference in the PR titles as well

fields.description:
Original summary: "Add check on creating/deleting a Repository"
Hi.
On my Backup/restore tests I wanted to find out what happens if I do this backup "online" (hot-backup). 
I found out that always the database has the main knowledge of the system configuration and it seems only the filesystem (stash_home) knows some extra informations about plugins and repositories.

In a scenario where you create a database backup followed by the backup of stash_home within a huge (unnatuaral) period of time you can describe following case:
if you create a repository within this time, it comes that if you restore that backup - this repository is gone. This is okay as at the time of the database backup the repository was unknown. But sadly this repository exists in the stash_home filesystem. First nobody knows BUT:
If you now try to create a new Repository on this restored system you get an error: stash says the reppsitory "repoID" (it's the repo-id-number) would exist... Looking into the filesystem you will see this repo existing...

I came to the conclusion that Stash iterates by 1 when creating a new repository... 
I'd like to ask you to improve that by checking first if a repo with the next iteration already exists and suggest to create a new repository with one more iteration. Also put a big warning that it seems there is a "ghost-repository"
this would not paralyze our users from creatign repositories when having a huge stash-instance later :)

You can imageine that there is obviously the same counter when deleting a repository within that timespan.

Maybe as a spanning view I'd suggest to store some metainformation (which stash-project, wich repo-name) inside the bulk-repository  on the filesystem. (I'll look for an open issue for that or open another one later)

Thanks!
fields.summary: Handle database/filesystem conflicts (due to incorrect backup/restore) more gracefully

fields.description:
If ssh is being used to reference stash url's the documentation should also change to reference the ssh commands that can be run. 

At present even when ssh is the only option from the clone button the documentation under the "You have an empty repository" header still references http(s).
fields.summary: Empty Respository documentation screen always references https

fields.description:
Currently repo permissions look like:

{noformat}
-rw-r--r--   1 vosipov  staff    73B  1 Nov 03:09 description
-rw-r--r--   1 vosipov  staff   270B  1 Nov 03:09 config
-rw-r--r--   1 vosipov  staff    23B  1 Nov 03:09 HEAD
-rw-r--r--   1 vosipov  staff     0B  1 Nov 03:09 .mailmap.new
drwxr-xr-x   4 vosipov  staff   136B  6 Nov 11:45 refs
drwxr-xr-x  72 vosipov  staff   2.4K  6 Nov 11:45 objects
drwxr-xr-x   3 vosipov  staff   102B  6 Nov 11:45 info
drwxr-xr-x  14 vosipov  staff   476B  6 Nov 11:45 hooks
drwxr-xr-x   2 vosipov  staff    68B  6 Nov 11:45 branches
drwxr-xr-x   3 vosipov  staff   102B  6 Nov 11:45 ..
drwxr-xr-x  11 vosipov  staff   374B  6 Nov 11:45 .
{noformat}

Unless there is a genuine need for Stash, permissions should be none for world and maybe even group.
fields.summary: Restrict file permissions of repos created through web interface

fields.description:
Relative links in markdown (README.md) do not respect the current branch.

To reproduce.

1. Create two branches, say 'master' and 'develop'.
2. Add a file to develop, say 'foo.c'.
3. Edit README.md with a relative link to foo.c:
```
[foo.c](foo.c)
```
4. Push to Stash.

When navigating the link on the develop branch, it points to the master branch which does not have this file.  The link does not preserve the URL query parameters, so loses the "?at=develop" branch bit.
fields.summary: Markdown relative links do not respect the current branch

fields.description: It would be good to have Stash DB schema changes/upgrades documented as part of release notes for customer reference.
fields.summary: Document DB schema changes in Stash release notes

fields.description:
As an administrator is allowed to [change the base url|https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/STASH/repos/stash/browse/service-impl/src/main/java/com/atlassian/stash/internal/server/ApplicationPropertiesServiceImpl.java#355] it maybe possible, with some social engineering, to escalate permissions to become a system administrator through the password email reset functionality. Password reset emails (correctly) use the configured base url to construct the password reset link and as an administrator can change it they can point it towards a domain of their choice.

An attack could look something like the following* :
1. An administrator logs in and changes stash's base url from 'http://example.com' to 'http://exampIe.com' (note the capital 'i' instead of an 'l') in the second domain.
2. The admin submits a 'forgot password request' against a system administrator account.
3. The admin waits until a system admin clicks on the password reset link in the 'password reset request' email.
4. At the admin's domain the password reset token is extracted from the system admins http request and is used to change the system administrator's password in stash.

\* Assume:
1. stash is running on http://example.com.
2. an evil admin controls the http://exampIe.com domain.
fields.summary: Changing the base url should require system administration privileges

fields.description:
I've finished a PR.  I don't want to approve it.  I'm not entirely sure what Decline does, so I don't want to press it.  I don't want to approve it because there are definitely more changes required at the moment.

So currently I IM the author and tell them I'm done.  And that's fine.  But I do miss Crucible's "Complete" button a little.

I'm not in love with the idea of adding a "changes required" button or a "complete" button.  It might be clutter to a lot of people.
fields.summary: What should I do when I finish a PR and there are changes required?

fields.description:
Referring to the [branch model|http://nvie.com/posts/a-successful-git-branching-model/], is nice to have the *Branch from* enforcement base on the chosen *Branch Type*. For example:
* hotfix: made from stable branch and merged into stable and development branch
* feature: made from development branch and merged into development branch.
* release: made from developemnt branch and merged into stable and development
fields.summary: Suggest "From Branch" on the create branch screen base on the "Branch type"
Add report functionality to Stash

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status – 03 January 2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for providing your thoughts and votes on this suggestion. We know it's been a while since this suggestion was raised and we're sorry to have kept you without a clear answer.

Your feedback has really helped us better understand the challenges you face being unable filter Jira-issues by pull request status. Despite our lack of communication, this problem is actually one of those areas we plan to improve. Right now we've decided to prioritise it on our roadmap.

Thank you again for all your feedback on this suggestion and we look forward to providing you with more updates as we work on the solution.

Best,
Anton Genkin | Product Manager - Integrations
{panel}
fields.summary: allow ability to query all jira issues with opened pull-request

fields.description: currently the user that makes the changes doesn't get any e-mail notification. in some cases we found this feature pretty useful
fields.summary: allow notification configuration for getting changes i've made

fields.description:
whenever you pull request and get comments, the only way to fix them when using stash is by adding new commit (because it uses git remote branches and once it get public you cannot rewind and change the history). 

gerrit solved it in a nice way. they have stated that you can amend to existing change (simply use the same change-id) and that's how gerrit will know how to correlate the commit to an existing review.

note that the review process can be pretty iterative, which means that we'll have initial single commit, and afterwards several "fixed comments from Gal's review".
fields.summary: ability to use local branches and amend

fields.description:
current Review board is pretty limited:
 * no ability to comment on a block.
 * missing a way to compare between 2 review snapshots.
 * see all files that are different between 2 snapshots.
 * open a bug (like in crucible) from the review itself.
 * no way to give general comment rather than line specific.
fields.summary: integrate with crucible

fields.description:
I have a jira user directory and i've connected the stash to use the same user directory as the jira.

in jira, the notifications are getting to the right user. in stash, user Guy had created a pull request, and put user Gal as a reviewer. Gal had commented on the request, Guy fixed the comments and pushed the new code. now when Gal writes additional comments, in the Jira bug it looks like jira user Eldad had written it (even that stash user Gal is written in the comment itself):


Eldad  added a comment - 16 minutes ago
Gal added a comment
sorry for not making this clear. the package com.fw should be across (com.fw -> com.od.fw)
04 November 2013 08:39 AM
[1]View comment
In reply to
Gal added a comment
1. remove copyrights from all files.
2. package should be com.odl.fw
01 November 2013 10:47 AM
You can [2]unwatch this pull request to stop receiving email updates.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
fields.summary: getting email notification from wrong user

fields.description:
{code}
$ for i in 5 6 7 8; do echo "2.$i";git log --oneline master ^origin/release/2.$i | wc -l; done
2.5
    4633
2.6
    3645
2.7
    2791
2.8
     812
{code}
Yet see attached - behind is out by a massive margin.
fields.summary: Branch List ahead/behind count incorrect

fields.description:
it would be nice if the backup client like so many other backup clients

is able to send the file to a s3 bucket or any other object stores.
so that it is a realy profesional backup service.

are there any plans or maby something similar for such a feature already?
fields.summary: Stash backup client should be able to send created tar to external data object store

fields.description: The backup client currently only looks for {{backup-config.properties}} in the current working directory.  Allow users to to specify where to find {{backup-config.properties}} on the command line with {{-Dbackup.config=<full path to config file>}}
fields.summary: Allow specifying backup properties location

fields.description: It would be great if there was an option in the settings of a Stash project where it would "unapprove" a pull request if there was an update to the code. That way anyone that had approved it would need to re-certify that the code is still good, and re-approve it.
fields.summary: "Unapprove" a pull request if the source code gets updated

fields.description:
My stash instance has a link to a commit that seems to be invalid.

There seems to be two different commits with the same content (see screen-shots). When cloning the repo one of them is reported as invalid

{code}
-bash-4.1$ git clone ssh://git@stash.calix.local:7999/EXA2/flow-mgr.git
Cloning into 'flow-mgr'...
remote: Counting objects: 633, done.
remote: Compressing objects: 100% (495/495), done.
remote: Total 633 (delta 453), reused 197 (delta 135)
Receiving objects: 100% (633/633), 219.01 KiB, done.
Resolving deltas: 100% (453/453), done.
-bash-4.1$ cd flow-mgr/
-bash-4.1$ git log 82797f364eddf79ce6ff394889863b23ccd27c26
fatal: bad object 82797f364eddf79ce6ff394889863b23ccd27c26

-bash-4.1$ git log 537c40f2d7b4845b0e0085ac9f823948307e1b89
commit 537c40f2d7b4845b0e0085ac9f823948307e1b89
Author: Evan Caves <evan.caves@calix.com>
Date:   Mon Sep 30 13:07:32 2013 -0700
{code}

The one invalid (82797f364eddf79ce6ff394889863b23ccd27c26) doesn't show on the commit stream either.

Where 82797f364eddf79ce6ff394889863b23ccd27c26 is coming from?
fields.summary: Invalid commit in stash

fields.description:
It would be great to have checkbox in repository configuration, together with "Allow forks" that would add to all forks same read visibility as original repository.

Use case is following: We have main repos that are used for builds, etc. Users that want to contribute are motivated to create forks, work on their changes there and then create pull request from their fork to main repo. However many reviewers want to checkout such branch locally and build it/browse it using IDE/run other tools there. This is not possible by default, as all forks are private. We think that as main repo has some visibility, all possible changes to it should have same visibility so everyone could review those changes by themselves locally, taking advantage of any tools they are using.
fields.summary: Add possibility to inherit read permissions, hooks, branch model and other settings to forked repositories
Consider allowing non-suffixed URL for raw file retrieval

fields.description:
I'd like to see the assignee of the issue corresponding to the issue key contained in each branch name on the branch list page.

See screenshot for example.
fields.summary: Show JIRA assignee in branch list

fields.description:
Since fork has modification in same branch as origin repo, then Synchronization stop works. I need manually press Synchronize buuton and select merge or discard strategy.

I wish to have Auto merge/Auto discard setting for forks.
fields.summary: Auto sync forks with given solution until conflicts detected

fields.description:
Steps:
1) visit http://coop.stb.intra/stash/projects/someProject/repos/someRepo/commits
2) click on any hash of a commit which the current logged on user did not make
3) click "back" in the browser

Expected:
the same list of commits as shown in step 1.

Actual:
Sometimes, a pseudorandom list of commits are shown, with incorrect dates. The order is always the same.

Workaround:
Instead of clicking "back" in the browser, always click the "Commits"-tab to get back.
fields.summary: Clicking "back" after viewing commit details sometimes lists commits with incorrect order

fields.description:
Pretty straight forward, it will be useful to have pretty print with diffs. 

For example this one works well enough and and is quick to implement. 

http://google-code-prettify.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/README.html
fields.summary: Pretty print for diffs
Notify FishEye of new commits
Support MariaDB

fields.description: JIRA issue editing needs some work. Setting a fix version is just not practical if there's a large number of fix versions.
fields.summary: JIRA issue transitions: Select2-fy multi selects in transition form

fields.description: It would be very useful when creating a branch from JIRA to be able to automatically transition from "Open" to "In progress". We might also want to transition from "In progress" to "Reopened" if a branch is deleted without a pull request (for instance, if the branch was created in the wrong repository). I would imagine adding Stash events for when a branch is created or deleted to the issue transitions page would be the most straightforward and flexible way to accomplish this.
fields.summary: Add branch created/deleted Stash events for issue transitions

fields.description:
It was going to be awesome if Stash could have [git-lfs|https://git-lfs.github.com] support.

This would help people who needs to work large binary files.
fields.summary: Support git-lfs for large file extensions

fields.description:
We use branch names of the form:

<product>/<version>

This works fine in git, and up until now every place in Stash I've tried.  There does appear to be a problem when switching branches in the file viewer:

If I view the version of a file on the master branch and then switch to the proj/1-0-0 branch I get a "Something went wrong while trying to serve your request. Try reloading the page.".  Reloading the page works and correctly shows the head version on the proj/1-0-0 branch.

Some notes:

I ran a live http request viewer and I noticed that clicking the branch name in the selector produces the following REST query:

http://<OUR SERVER>/rest/api/latest/projects/PROJ/repos/utils/commits/proj%2F1-0-0?path=modules&avatarSize=32

I'd imagine the %2F is the problem here as I don't think the branch name should be url encoded in the REST query body (that should just be a "/").

Doing a reload means its a new page query with the url:

http://<OUR SERVER>/projects/PROJ/repos/utils/browse/modules?at=refs%2Fheads%2Fproj%2F1-0-0

In this case the branch is going in as a parameter value where it should be URL encoded and so the page loads fine.

This is a right pain for us and makes the file viewer far more awkward to use when moving between branches.
fields.summary: Switching branches in file view causes internal error with branch names containing a "/"

fields.description:
In the repository list when you scroll to the bottom it automatically loads in the next "page" of results.  This is all well and good: it makes the initial load fast and the pages come in quickly as you scroll.

The problem we've noticed is that you can scroll the page to the point where the last entry is on screen and the footer partially visible without triggering the load of the next page (the scrollbar is just a sliver above the bottom).  This makes it look like the the list has finished loading when it hasn't.

Ideally the load should start when the last entry in the current list comes on screen (some sort of visibility trigger perhaps) rather than the scrollbar being right at the bottom.  That said even a "X more repositories, scroll down to load" message after the last entry in the way the "no more repositories" entry shows up once you've reached the real bottom would be an improvement.

Our concern is that someone unfamiliar with the project and Stash may not even realise another notch down on the mouse wheel could cause more repos to appear.

Not a big issue, at all, but we thought it worth raising.

This same issue may affect other infinite scroll pages, but I haven't looked at them in detail.
fields.summary: Better handling of infinite scroll in repository list

fields.description:
After upgrading to 2.8.2, I can't upgrade UPM or any other add-ons.  Nor can I install new add-ons.

When I try to upgrade UPM, I am told "The system attempted to connect to http://stash.mydomainname.com/rest/plugins/1.0/pending/28f640a... This may indicate a problem with the base URL configuration of your instance."

The base URL is properly set to https://stash.mydomainname.com.  The stash instance sits behind an nginx reverse proxy.  This setup has been working for months.  Something in the new Stash version or UPM seems to be defaulting to http:// rather than using the stored base URL.
fields.summary: UPM using wrong base URL
SSH SCM Cache causes " c.a.s.i.s.g.p.ssh.GitSshScmRequest upload-pack did not complete. It will be assumed the command failed" errors

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – December 2017|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
Hi everyone,

We have recently reviewed this issue and the overall interest in the problem. As the issue hasn't collect votes, watchers, comments, or support cases from many customers during its lifetime, it's very low on our priority list, and will not be fixed in the foreseeable future. That's why we've decided to resolve it as *Timed Out*.

Although we're aware the issue is still important to those of you who were involved in the conversations around it, we want to be clear in managing your expectations. The Bitbucket Server team is focusing on issues that have broad impact and high value, reflected by the number of comments, votes, support cases, and customers interested. Please consult the [Atlassian Bugfix Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/atlassian-bug-fixing-policy-201294573.html] for more details.

We understand how disappointing this decision may be, but we hope you'll appreciate our transparent approach and communication. If you're really passionate about this suggestion, please comment with your case in detail and we'll reconsider. Atlassian will continue to watch this issue for further updates, so please feel free to share your thoughts in the comments.

Thank you,

Imran Khan
Product Manager - Bitbucket Server and Data Center
{panel}

While reviewing the Stash documentation I spotted the Stash Backup Client in the best practices for backups. I love the idea, but I'm not wild about having a SuperAdmin's credentials inside a crontab file on the server.  

I wanted to throw out a request that a dedicated backup user be created that is restricted from actual logins and allowed read-only access to the critical bits.

It is superb that you guys have taken this important step into account and built in an integrated approach that can be bolted on by those who need it to take care of such a critical task.
fields.summary: create dedicated backup user for backup client jobs
Ability to search for changesets

fields.description:
h1. Add support for MariaDB to Stash

Currently Stash supports MySQL as described in the [Supported platforms|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASH/Supported+platforms]. However, Stash is not tested against variants of MySQL like Percona and MariaDB. For support, you should switch to a normal MySQL installation as per the document's description.

This issue intends to engage us on a research about the viability of adding full support to MariaDB.

Currently we mapped two scenarios:

h2. Scenario 1

When trying to upload to a Git repository, the following error is displayed:

{noformat}
[xxx@attlasin_server git_project]# git push origin master
Password:
Counting objects: 21183, done.
Delta compression using up to 3 threads.
Compressing objects: 100% (8287/8287), done.
Writing objects: 100% (21183/21183), 20.18 MiB | 8.28 MiB/s, done.
Total 21183 (delta 12854), reused 20762 (delta 12433)
remote: Hook com.atlassian.stash.hooks.permissions.internal.BranchPermissionHook failed. Error:
remote: There was a SQL exception thrown by the Active Objects library:
remote: Database:
remote:         - name:MySQL
remote:         - version:5.5.5-10.0.4-MariaDB
remote:         - minor version:5
remote:         - major version:5
remote: Driver:
remote:         - name:MySQL Connector Java
remote:         - version:mysql-connector-java-5.1.25 ( Revision: ${bzr.revision-id} )
remote:
remote: com.mysql.jdbc.exceptions.jdbc4.MySQLSyntaxErrorException: Specified key was too long; max key length is 767 bytes
{noformat}

h3. Workaround for Scenario 1

- Find query in the log:

{noformat}
2013-10-25 16:55:01,169 ERROR [threadpool:thread-7] marek.knappe 1014x21271x1 1vmdfi9 122.99.118.175 "POST /scm/cg/compass-gateway.git/git-receive-pack HTTP/1.1" net.java.ao.sql Exception executing SQL update <CREATE INDEX index_ao_6978bb_res847341420 ON AO_6978BB_RESTRICTED_REF(REF_VALUE)>
{noformat}

- Execute the query manually:

{noformat}
MariaDB [ecc_stash]> CREATE INDEX index_ao_6978bb_res847341420 ON AO_6978BB_RESTRICTED_REF(REF_VALUE);
Query OK, 0 rows affected, 1 warning (0.06 sec)
Records: 0  Duplicates: 0  Warnings: 1
{noformat}

- Probable root cause:

{panel}
It's likely that 1 warning part is the culprit. The JDBC driver probably doesn't differentiate between warnings and errors, so either is probably treated as the SQL statement failing.
{panel}

h2. Scenario 2

"An error occurred" pops up on all repo pages. The details state "An error occurred while processing the request. Check the server logs for more information."

{noformat}
2013-10-24 04:36:27,940 ERROR [http-bio-7994-exec-2] kdonarski 276x4235x1 1kh3kc1 79.173.31.46 "GET /rest/sync/latest/projects/OSA/repos/osa HTTP/1.1" net.java.ao.sql Exception executing SQL update <CREATE INDEX index_ao_02a6c0_rej1887153917 ON AO_02A6C0_REJECTED_REF(REF_ID)>
java.sql.SQLException: Index column size too large. The maximum column size is 767 bytes.
...

2013-10-24 04:36:27,967 ERROR [http-bio-7994-exec-2] kdonarski 276x4235x1 1kh3kc1 79.173.31.46 "GET /rest/sync/latest/projects/OSA/repos/osa HTTP/1.1" c.a.s.r.e.UnhandledExceptionMapper Unhandled exception while processing REST call
com.atlassian.activeobjects.internal.ActiveObjectsSqlException: There was a SQL exception thrown by the Active Objects library:
Database:
	- name:MySQL
	- version:5.5.30-MariaDB
	- minor version:5
	- major version:5
Driver:
	- name:MySQL-AB JDBC Driver
	- version:mysql-connector-java-5.1.23 ( Revision: ${bzr.revision-id} )

java.sql.SQLException: Index column size too large. The maximum column size is 767 bytes.
...
Caused by: java.sql.SQLException: Index column size too large. The maximum column size is 767 bytes.
{noformat}

h3. Workaround for Scenario 2

{panel}
At the moment the immediate workaround is to disable the Ref Syncing plugin that is affected by this error. To do that, go to {{Administration -> Manage Add-ons}} and select 'Show all' in the drop-down for filtering plugins. Find a plugin named Atlassian Stash Repository Ref Synchronizer and disable that plugin. This should cause the error to disappear from your repository pages.
{panel}
fields.summary: Add support for MariaDB to Stash

fields.description:
It would be useful to have a way to CC a user or add them as a participant.

The use case for this is if there's a particular question for a user about a bit of code (that use case overlaps partially with STASH-2842 ) or where another user needs to be aware of comments etc on a pull request, but doesn't need to be involved as a formal reviewer.

(Apologies if this is already supported or a duplicate - I did have a good look through the jira issues and couldn't find anything relevant)
fields.summary: Allow a user to be CCed / added as a participant on a pull request

fields.description:
h3. Symptom

Cloning a large repository (in this case > 4Gb) from Stash over SSH fails with the following error:

{noformat}
Receiving objects:  27% (98115/357420), 422.96 MiB | 3.73 MiB/s
fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly

fatal: early EOF

fatal: recursion detected in die handler
{noformat}

The problem has been traced back to the SSH caching support that was added in the 1.2.x version of the scm-cache plugin. 

h3. Workaround

Disable the caching over SSH by:

{noformat}
curl -i -H "Content-Type: application/json" -X DELETE --user admin-user "http://my-stash.com/rest/scm-cache/latest/config/protocols/SSH"
{noformat}
fields.summary: Clones over SSH fail for large repositories

fields.description:
*Rating*: :) Good

{panel:title=What do you like?|borderColor=#ccc| titleBGColor=#c2ffa2|bgColor=#fff}
The UI loading fast.
And Stash developers.  They are so nice.  And their PMs too.
Oh, and having limits on the amount of stuff in the UI so that it loads fast is definitely good.  I'm NOT in any way suggesting that limits aren't good.  You guys are awesome for having limits on loaded content from the outset.  
{panel}

{panel:title=What needs to be improved?|borderColor=#ccc| titleBGColor=#faacad|bgColor=#fff}
Navigating to specific pull requests.  Let me describe a workflow I do.

Situation: I know an issue key, and I know it will be in the branch name, and I want to go to the pull request.  I work in a big team and we have a lot of open pull requests.

What happens:
* I go to the pull-requests screen
* I search for the issue key using the browser's search.
* The search turns up nothing.
* I feel confused, I really expected a PR to be found.
* I remember stash has an infinite scroll thingy.
* I scroll.
* More rows are loaded
* I search again.
* I find the PR I was looking for.  Yay.

Possible fixes:
* Sort the PRs the other way around
* Provide an explicit search for pull requests.
* Integrate Pull requests into the Source tab in JIRA so I don't even come to this screen in the first place
* Load more rows on failed browser search?  I'm guessing that's not possible but I don't actually know.
* Show the _END_ of the list on load and have a _Show Older PRs_ control at the top of the list.  That way it would be more obvious to a user that the entire list isn't being shown.
{panel}
fields.summary: The UI loading fast.  And Stash developers.  They ...

Thank you for your attention :)

fields.description:
Occasionally we get 500 errors back from stash.

I'm not 100% sure what the trigger is, but it may be related to users waiting a long time (20 minutes) between a form loading and them submitting it.

The backtrace (attached) seems the same in all cases.

The error just says "Please contact your system administrator".

In this case, it was the project creation form that was being submitted, http://our-server-name:7990/projects?create

Clicking back, then reload, then re-filling the form with the exact same data, then submitting again, seems to work.

I'm not sure if this can be replicated.

fields.description:
My team is expanding from a single Stash project. Our project consists of a Hardware test controller, multiple peripherial unit tests & peripherial libraries. We are now moving on to multiple projects (System level and beyond). We intend to have code reuse (libraries) from the initial project. Each unit level test and each library are individual Repos, I'd like to be able to map library Repos in to project #2 and beyond.

Both projects & Repos currently have the same permissions
fields.summary: Sharing Repos among Stash projects

fields.description: See screenshot.

fields.description: Sometimes someone make 'git push -f' to stash. And we can't catch this moment in logs.
fields.summary: Logging of `git push`

fields.description:
h2. Background
h3. Clean History?
In our team we want a git version history which contains one commit for each Jira ID, i.e. one commit for each feature (further referred to as clean history..).

h2. Collaboration on Changes
When a developer wants to make a change to the main line code the developer will push a new branch to the stash server with the Jira ID of the feature. The developer then goes to the stash interface and creates a pull request for this branch.

Another person on the team will review the code. Ideally there will be some discussion about the change and some improvements will be suggested.


h2. Iteration on Changes
I am going to explain two possible workflows on iteration on changes and explain the issue with each.

h3. Workflow 1
Taking on board the suggested improvements from the review process, the developer makes a *new commit* and *pushes this commit* to the same branch. Thus creating a second commit on that branch.

This process continues until all parties are happy with the change and the branch is merged with the mainline.

h4. Issue
When the merge happens, all of the individual commits are visible on the mainline branch plus one 'merge' commit i.e. we don't have one commit for each feature.


h3. Workflow 2
Taking on board the suggested improvements, the developer *amends the existing commit* and then *force pushes the change* to the existing branch on stash.

This process continues until all parties are happy with the change and the branch is merged with the mainline.

h4. Issue
When the developer does a force, he/she runs the risk of accidentally overwriting another branch or pushing a corrupted history.

h2. Summary
We need some way to iterate on changes during the review process while maintaining a clean history. On top of this we do not want to use the --force flag in git because it could corrupt branches on the stash server.
fields.summary: Enable the ability to iterate on changes during the review process while maintaining "clean history"

fields.description: The username tooltip when hovering over PR reviewers is different (and more useful) than the tooltip for PR authors on the list PRs page.
fields.summary: Authors in the pull request list should use tipsy for their display name like the reviewers do

fields.description:
Starting with version 2.8.1 (I think it should be 2.8.x, but I did not test with 2.8.0) this dependency is present on plugin classpath:

{code}
<dependency>
    <groupId>javax.servlet</groupId>
    <artifactId>javax.servlet-api</artifactId>
    <version>3.0.1</version>
</dependency>
{code}

As the result when plugin is packaged manifest ends with following item:

{code}
javax.servlet;resolution:=optional;version="[3.0,4)",
javax.servlet.http;resolution:=optional;version="[3.0,4)",
{code}

However, this dependency cannot be found in runtime by OSGI container because the dependency that is visible to plugins is:

{code}
<dependency>
    <groupId>javax.servlet</groupId>
    <artifactId>servlet-api</artifactId>
    <version>2.5</version>
</dependency>
{code}

This causes a error during plugin initialization.

Steps to reproduce:
- Created a plugin for Stash 2.8.1 and add one servlet component to it
- Try to test it using SDK

Expected result:
- Plugin initialized properly

Observed result:
- Manage add-on admin pages shows warning message for plugin https://bitbucket.org/bolyuba/stash-block-pullrequest-addon/issue-attachment/8/bolyuba/stash-block-pullrequest-addon/1381835142.1/8/problem.png

- Logs indicate that class HttpServlet is missing https://answers.atlassian.com/upfiles/log_10.txt

Work around:
- Exclude dependency of stash-page-objects in pom.xml of the plugin

{code}
        <dependency>
            <groupId>com.atlassian.stash</groupId>
            <artifactId>stash-page-objects</artifactId>
            <scope>provided</scope>
            <exclusions>
                <exclusion>
                    <groupId>javax.servlet</groupId>
                    <artifactId>javax.servlet-api</artifactId>
                </exclusion>
            </exclusions>
        </dependency>
{code}

More info can be found here:
* https://bitbucket.org/bolyuba/stash-block-pullrequest-addon/issue/8/stash-281-servlet-api-jar-dependency

* https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/222232/httpservlet-not-found
fields.summary: Stash dependency leaking into plugin dependencies
Mismatches in SQL Server database names cause inscrutable migration errors

fields.description: One major feature request for us is to see in which Pull Request a commit was introduced
fields.summary: see in which Pull Request a commit was introduced

fields.description: - blame in pull request view, like Fisheye/Crucible have
fields.summary: blame in pull request view

fields.description:
BackupService & BackupController is serving up the wrong database backup zip when asked for the latest one. This means backups are being generated where the filesystem and database do not match. This could lead to data loss when restoring.

Specifically, if the delta between two backups in milliseconds is greater than Integer.MAX_VALUE which is about 25 days, the comparison of last modified dates for two files will return an invalid value, ordering will fail and the wrong database backup file will be designated as the latest one.
fields.summary: Backups may be generated with out-of-date database data

fields.description:
To reproduce do the following : 

1. Make a request for commits within range through a browser. 
   # Log in to a stash server
   # make the following request (must be a request that has multiple pages) 
    https://<stash-server>/rest/api/1.0/projects/<projectKey>/repos/<repoSlug>/commits?since=<since git ref>&unti=<until git ref>&start=0
   # The result response json will have the nextPageStart field set as described in the documentation.

2. Make the same request using curl
  # curl ' https://<stash-server>/rest/api/1.0/projects/<projectKey>/repos/<repoSlug>/commits?since=<since git ref>&unti=<until git ref>&start=0' -u <username>
  # the response json does not have the nextPageStart field set as described in the documentation. 

Expected Outcome : 

All requests for resources that are pagenated should contain the nextPageStart field to facilitate the processing of pagenated responses. This should also be the case when using the groovy HTTPBuilder library or curl. 

Actual Outcome : 
Requests made through a browser (chrome tested) does have the same out as is shown in the documentation. But requests made via a script using curl or HTTPBuilder library does not have the nextPageStart field even for pagenated responses. 

The request that this was seen with is documented here : https://developer.atlassian.com/static/rest/stash/2.8.2/stash-rest.html#idp2683120
fields.summary: Stash REST API does not consistently provide a nextPageStart on paginated resources

fields.description:
stash 2.8.x is not backwards compatible for stash.widget.avatarGroup
the method has been replaced by groupAvatarWithName

Please always make sure to

# Add comment to release notes 

Thanks
fields.summary: Stash 2.8.x breaks stash.widget API

A screenshot is attached.

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – December 2017|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
Hi everyone,

We have recently reviewed this issue and the overall interest in the problem. As the issue hasn't collect votes, watchers, comments, or support cases from many customers during its lifetime, it's very low on our priority list, and will not be fixed in the foreseeable future. That's why we've decided to resolve it as *Timed Out*.

Although we're aware the issue is still important to those of you who were involved in the conversations around it, we want to be clear in managing your expectations. The Bitbucket Server team is focusing on issues that have broad impact and high value, reflected by the number of comments, votes, support cases, and customers interested. Please consult the [Atlassian Bugfix Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/atlassian-bug-fixing-policy-201294573.html] for more details.

We understand how disappointing this decision may be, but we hope you'll appreciate our transparent approach and communication. If you're really passionate about this suggestion, please comment with your case in detail and we'll reconsider. Atlassian will continue to watch this issue for further updates, so please feel free to share your thoughts in the comments.

Thank you,

Imran Khan
Product Manager - Bitbucket Server and Data Center
{panel}

We have a feature request for Stash we would like to:

Allow onsite System Administrators to override/extend the PermissionSrvice in the Stash API to restrict access to projects/repositories based on session attributes e.g. from a users X.509  cilent certifiecate. The restricted projects/repositories should no show up in any list fo that user.
fields.summary: Allow plugins to further restrict Stash's authorization checks

fields.description: We found that by default TortoiseGIT would hang after  “Resolving deltas” hits 100% when cloning a repository from stash.silabs.com. The problem did not happen using command line git or if cloning a repo from gitaus001.silabs.com. The issue can be fixed by going to the Network settings and changing the SSH client from TortisePlink.exe to the plink.exe that comes with putty (PuTTY/plink.exe)
fields.summary: tortoisegit default ssh client hangs
Document move repository changes in 2.8 API changelog

fields.description:
Due to: jQuery executes scripts as soon as it is appended to a jQuery object rather than when it is appended to the dom. So the input might not be in the dom but the script initialising it has already run.

Workaround: Add the branch selector field to a jQuery object that's already in the dom.
fields.summary: Branch selector field renders but does not work with no js errors
JIRA Feature Discovery behaves badly when switching tabs

fields.description: I would like to be able to notify someone when I am done reviewing a pull request instead of them receiving an email each time I make a comment on the code.
fields.summary: Allow code review to be over and send an email then

fields.description:
In order to have sensible names for projects and repositories, we would like to enforce naming conventions at the time of creation.

In our case:

We would like capitalised, space separated project names, eg: Moon Landing
We would like hyphen separated repository names: eg: sea-of-tranquility
fields.summary: Ability to enforce naming convention for projects and repositories

fields.description: As a Stash user I want to be able to filter on a certain user in the commit overview, this makes it easier to find certain commits which I am looking for.
fields.summary: Filter on author in commit view

fields.description: When the callback server accepts a connection for hook information, it closes the _streams_ on the {{Socket}} but it does not close the _{{Socket}}_. This results in a buildup of half-closed sockets which are only fully released when their finalizers are run by the garbage collector.
fields.summary: Hook callback sockets are not closed correctly

fields.description:
Example: 

{code:title=/home/stash/data/repositories/1/config|borderStyle=solid}
[stash]
    hierarchyid = 9b3731760974b2b323e7
[repository]
    name = test-repo
[project]
    name = PROJECT
{code}

In this case we can easy get project and repository names in hook with command: `git config --get project.name`
fields.summary: Store project and repository names in git config

fields.description:
From the clone this drop down, to the empty repository helper, the displayed URLs should be configurable.

- the clone SSH url should use the current users login name (viz. stash@)
- the empty repo helper should use ssh:// URLs, be a site wide or per-screen option.
fields.summary: All displayed URLs should be configurable

fields.description:
Hi,

Looking at the automated branch merge support in the latest version we are very excited with the added potential. The only problem is that we are not able to use the automation and would want a more manually control-able alternative/complement.

Once that the pull request is accepted a list of potential target branches could be suggested and flagged by the user in order to start the merge on those selected branches.

We would want the manual control because:
* We usually apply fixes on a branch of the master branch which we would integrate using a pull request (on the master). After that the developer merges the branch to other release branches.
* We do not always apply a fix on all release branches - sometimes we apply it on branch 1 and 3 but not 2.
* We want to decide on a case by case basis if the merge back is needed for the particular fix.

Would something like this be acceptable in the product?
fields.summary: Support for non-automated merging of a pull request to multiple branches

fields.description: For people migrating from Bitbucket to Stash, there should be a way to import the users and groups from Bitbucket as well as the Pull Requests and Commit Comments.
fields.summary: Create a way to import Bitbucket data

fields.description:
In a Branch list plugin I had knocked up myself, I made the behind/ahead numbers clickable towards the commit page, this will clearly show which X/Y commits the behind/ahead git is talking about.

Basically you can point the soy template to the repo/commits?until=branch1..branch2 and reverse it for the other link, it will just give you a git diff of the two branches which is exactly what we wanna see.

I also added a filter checkbox on the commit window, which filters out all merges (instead of showing them gray), so you get a clear view of the branch diffs, a nice plus.
fields.summary: Branch list: make behind/ahead clickable to commits window

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of December 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5|titleBGColor=#3C78B5|bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,

Thanks to everyone for voting and commenting on this suggestion. Your input in the comments helps us understand how this affects you and what you're hoping to accomplish with Bitbucket Server.

We spend a significant amount of time on an ongoing basis to determine our product investments in Bitbucket Server. Unfortunately, we are not currently planning to address this suggestion in the next 12 months. In the last 12 months, we've resolved 10 of the top 30 feature requests, and our upcoming roadmap includes a number of other top voted suggestions, including in-browser editing, improvements to search functionality, better JIRA integration, and providing an even better code review experience.

I understand that this may be disappointing, but we believe it’s important for us to be open, honest and transparent with our customers. Product feedback is collected from a number of different sources and is evaluated when planning the product roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

Norman Ma

Product Manager - Bitbucket Server
{panel}

Our team is thoroughly enjoying the new branching features in Stash 2.8 along with the JIRA 6.1 integration, but there is one little issue...

We follow a Github-style feature-branch workflow, where master is considered "production-ready", and all changes are handled in branches that are eventually merged back in.  The issue we're having is that while "bugfix" and "feature" work for many instances, and "custom" handles the rest, we'd like to enforce project-specific branch types (For example "client/" for billable client customizations...)

Would be nice if there was a way to define custom types/prefixes in the repo settings, and have them show up under "Branch Type" when creating a new branch.
fields.summary: Custom Branch Types/Prefixes

fields.description:
It would be nice to have a dashboard for management, where we can see the total check-ins history with the individual developers and changes made to the repositories.

Right now there is only a way to check for individual repositories but not for all the repositories in stash.

Thanks!!!
fields.summary: Checkin Report

fields.description:
It would be nice if certain engineers could be assigned multiple votes for reviews.

Everyone isn't necessarily equal,  the lead developer will probably have better insights in code reviews than a junior engineer who has been working 3months... Having two junior engineers approve a third junior engineer's work is obviously different than having two lead engineers approve a third lead's work...

An alternative would be to change the number of votes required to be based on the submitter... but that feels wrong.


Maybe this could be done using groups (i.e. assigning a person to the Lead Engineer group and then giving people in the Lead Engineer group 2 votes).
fields.summary: Allow users to have more than one vote for pull request reviews

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

As user1: Create a project
As user1: Set Default Project Access to: Read
As user2: Access the project
As user1: Set Default Project Access to: No Access
As user2: Access the project again

Expected behavior: When user2 tries to access the project after the default access has been changed back to no access, user2 should not be able to get in.

Actual behavior: User2 can continue to access the project until stash is rebooted.
fields.summary: Project access is cached until a reboot

fields.description: Since Detached HEAD is not supported in Stash at the moment, it will be better to have an ability to detect Detached HEAD in repository and auto update HEAD reference to prevent Detached HEAD
fields.summary: Ability to detect Detached HEAD in repository and auto update HEAD reference to prevent Detached HEAD

fields.description:
In certain situations, ref syncing (fork syncing) can raise {{RepositoryRefsChangedEvent}} with one or more {{RefChange}} instances that have "short hashes" for {{getFromHash()}} and {{getToHash()}}. _This does not impair Stash's built-in functionality._ However, there are plugins which are relying on {{RefChange}} instances always having full 40-byte hashes. Such events from ref syncing cause those plugins to fail.

An example of such a failure:
{noformat}
2013-10-09 02:05:12,127 ERROR [AtlassianEvent::pool-3-thread-2] jdoe 125x1445462x4 1gvfqnp 127.0.0.1 SSH - git-receive-pack '/KEY/repo.git' c.a.e.i.AsynchronousAbleEventDispatcher There was an exception thrown trying to dispatch event 'com.atlassian.stash.repository.sync.RefsSynchronizedEvent[source=com.atlassian.stash.internal.repository.sync.DefaultRefSyncService@28f4a2f8]' from the invoker 'SingleParameterMethodListenerInvoker{method=public void com.wittified.TaskRepositoryEvent.postReceive(com.atlassian.stash.event.RepositoryRefsChangedEvent), listener=com.wittified.TaskRepositoryEvent@2dfe326f}'.
java.lang.RuntimeException: An error occurred while executing an external process: [56bbef7]: Unexpected output; expected a 'commit' object
        at
{noformat}
fields.summary: Ref syncing raises RepositoryRefsChangedEvents with bad RefChanges
Plugin tutorial outdated

fields.description:
Currently, Webhook plugin post a simple webhook URL without any credential.

There should be an option to use Applink data to post the webhook URL with a credential to other Atlassian Application such as FishEye.
fields.summary: Webhook plugin need option to use Applink data to post an URL

fields.description:
I like upward merging from stable branch to master. Unfortunately I can't enable upward merging because I'm not an admin.

The JIRA project has a great description that tells you who is an admin on the project, but I can't see that on the Project page.

That description on the project seems to be a workaround for the fact that it's difficult to be able to easily contact the admins of a repository in order to request a configuration change as an end user. Could the product better enable end users to contact their administrators, or surface features in a way that non-admin users can know their presence then bug their admins to enable them?
fields.summary: Enable end users to contact their administrator(s)
